isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3600, 3800, 4000FBC - LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION

svcsubproc.title: Back-Up Lights
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (63) is moved to the start or ignition position, power is applied to circuit 13, fuse A1, circuit 71, connector (2), circuit 71, connector (304), and a black wire to the back-up light switch. When the back-up light switch contacts close, power flows through a white wire, connector (304), circuit 71A, connector (2), and circuit 71A to the body builder connector (194).

svcsubproc.title: Fog Lights
svcsubproc.para: When the headlights are on and low beams are selected, power is fed to circuit 64A from the low beam headlight circuit or from the Daytime Running Light (DRL) module (165) if so equipped. When the fog light switch (98) is moved to the on position, power flows through circuit 64A, connector (115), circuit 64A, and the indicator in the fog light switch (98). The ground path for the indicator is circuit 64-GA, and 64-G to cab ground.
Power also flows from the fog light switch through circuit 64B to the fog light relay (99). Power then energizes the relay by flowing through its coil and ground circuit 64-G to cab ground.

With the relay energized, power flows from the (J1) junction block through circuit 14A, circuit F3, circuit 64, connector (115) [jumper connector (115A), circuit 64, and connector (115B) with DRL], and circuit 64 to fog light relay (99). Power also flows through the N.O. contacts, circuit 64C, dash connector (2), circuit 64C, connector (441), circuit 64C, connector (501), and circuit 64C to a splice. From the splice power flows through circuit 64D to the left fog light and through circuit 64E to the right fog light.

The left fog light ground is through circuit 64-GC to a splice and the right fog light ground is through circuit 64-GD to the same splice. From the splice, ground is through circuit 64-GB, connector (501), [circuit 64-GB/11-GB, and connector (425) with 3800 or 4000FBC only], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to cranking motor ground.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuitry With Tilt Steering Column and Without DRL
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight dimmer switch is in the low beam position, and the headlight switch (60) is moved to the headlight on position, power flows from body builder feed stud (J1) through circuit 50, the closed headlight switch contacts, and circuit 51A (circuit 51 with 3600) to turn signal switch/Lift To Dim switch connector (191). Power flows through the switch contacts, connector (191), circuit 53B/53, dash connector (2), circuit 53, connector (413) [connector (526) with 3600] and circuit 53 to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 53B to the left headlight low beam element and through circuit 53A to the right headlight low beam element.

When the headlight dimmer switch is moved to the high beam position, power flows from the switch contacts, connector (191), circuit 52D/52 (circuit 52C/52 with 3600), connector (2), circuit 52, connector (413) [connector (526) with 3600] and circuit 52 to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 52C to the left headlight high beam element, and through circuit 52B to the right headlight high beam element.

The ground path for the left headlight is circuit 11-GC/11-GB, front end harness connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ with 3600) to cranking motor ground. The ground path for the right headlight is circuit 11-GE/11-GB, front end harness connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GF with 3600) to cranking motor ground.

When the high beams are energized, power is also fed from circuit 52 to circuit 52A, and the high beam indicator at instrument cluster connector (27). The cluster is grounded through connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-GB (circuit 28-GB/11-GC with 3600) to cab ground.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuitry With Stationary Steering Column and Without DRL, 3800, 4700FBC, 4900FBC
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight dimmer switch is in the low beam position, and the headlight switch (60) is moved to the headlight on position, power flows from body builder feed stud (J1) through circuit 50, the closed headlight switch contacts, and circuit 51 to the Left To Dim relay (100) contacts, and circuit 51F to the relay coil. Power flows through the coil of relay (100) and through circuit 51D to the turn signal switch/Lift To Dim switch connector (192), the switch contacts, connector (192), and circuit 51-G/11-G to cab ground. This energizes relay (100) and allows power to flow through circuit 53A/53, dash connector (2), circuit 53, connector (413), and circuit 53 to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 53B to the left headlight low beam element, and through circuit 53A to the right headlight low beam element.

When the Lift To Dim switch is moved to high beam position, the switch contacts open and the ground path to relay (100) is removed. This de-energizes the relay and power flows through circuit 52C/52, dash connector (2), circuit 52, connector (413), and circuit 52 to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 52C to the left headlight high beam element, and through circuit 52B to the right headlight high beam element.

The ground path for the left headlight is circuit 11-GC/11-GB, connector (425), and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to cranking motor ground. The ground path for the right headlight is circuit 11-GE/11-GB, connector (425), and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to cranking motor ground.

When the high beams are energized, power is also fed from circuit 52 to circuit 52A, and the high beam indicator at instrument cluster connector (27). The cluster is grounded through connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-GB to cab ground.

Power is also applied to the body builder feed stud (J1), circuit 14A, fuse D3, and circuit 50A to Flash To Pass relay (101) contacts and circuit 51C to the relay coil. When the turn signal lever is pushed forward and held in the Flash To Pass position, power flows through the coil of relay (101), circuit 51E, connector (192), the dimmer switch contacts, connector (192), and circuit 51-G/11-G to cab ground.
This energizes relay (101) and allows power to flow through the N.O. contacts, circuit 52B/52, connector (2), circuit 52, connector (413) and circuit 52 to a splice.

From the splice, power flows through circuit 52C to the left headlight high beam element, and through circuit 52B to the right headlight high beam element, causing the high beams to illuminate and signal the driver's intent to pass.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuitry With Tilt Steering Column and With DRL
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight dimmer switch is in the low beam position, and the headlight switch (60) is moved to the headlight on position, power flows from the body builder feed stud (J1) through circuit 50, the closed headlight switch contacts, and circuit 51A (circuit 51 with 3600) to turn signal switch/Lift To Dim switch connector (191). Power flows through the switch contacts, connector (191), circuit 53B/53, dash connector (2), circuit 53, connector (413) [connector (526) with 3600] and circuit 53 to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 53B to the left headlight low beam element, and through circuit 53A to the right headlight low beam element.

When the headlight dimmer switch is moved to the high beam position, power flows from the switch contacts, connector (191), circuit 52D/52 (circuit 52C/52 with 3600), connector (2), circuit 52, connector (413) (connector [526] with 3600) and circuit 52 to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 52C to the left headlight high beam element, and through circuit 52B to the right headlight high beam element.

The ground path for the left headlight is circuit 11-GC/11-GB, front end harness connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ with 3600) to cranking motor ground. The ground path for the right headlight is circuit 11-GE/11-GB, front end harness connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ with 3600) to cranking motor ground.

When the high beams are energized, power is also fed from circuit 52 to circuit 52A, and the high beam indicator at instrument cluster connector (27). The cluster is grounded through connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-GB (circuit 28-GB/11-GC with 3600) to cab ground.

For Daytime Running Lights, an electronic module is utilized. Power flows from the body builder feed stud (J1) through circuit 66, fuse K1, and circuit 66A and connector (165) to power the module. The ground path for the module is connector (165) and circuit 66-GA to cab ground.

When the key switch (63) is moved to the ignition or accessories position, voltage is applied to circuit 12, fuse E1, circuit 66F, and DRL module (165). This powers up the DRL module, and allows it to monitor the voltage on the low beam headlight circuitry by way of circuit 66C. The module then supplies power to the fog light switch over circuit 64A only when the low beam headlights are energized.

Whenever the key switch is on and the headlights are not switched to low beams, the module provides power to the high beam elements, over circuit 66E, at about 60% of full power. Whenever the headlights are switch on and high beams are selected, the power supplied through the headlight switch will override the 60% power level to a full 100% level.

svcsubproc.title: Panel Lights
svcsubproc.para: From body builder feed stud (J1), power is applied to circuit 14C, fuse E2, circuit 58, and headlight switch (60). When the headlight switch (60) is in the park lights or headlights on position, power is fed to a rheostat (variable resistor) in the switch.

From the rheostat, an adjustable voltage is applied to circuit 62 and feed block (3M). From the feed block (3M), power is applied to circuit 62A and the left cluster (26), circuit 62B and the center cluster (27), and circuit 62C and the right cluster (28). Power is also supplied to circuit 62E, connector (219), and circuit 62E to the automatic transmission light, and circuit 62E, connector (219), and circuit 92A to the ABS/Allison connector (377). From the feed block, power is also supplied through circuit 62F to the body builder connector (194), and circuit 62H and connector (30) for the cruise control panel light.

The ground path for the left cluster is circuit 62-GA/11-GB (62-GA/11-GC with 3600) to cab ground. The center cluster ground is 62-GB/11-GB (62-GB/11-GC with 3600) to cab ground, and for the right cluster, ground is through circuit 62-GC/11-G to cab ground. The transmission light is grounded at its mounting bracket. The cruise control panel light is grounded through circuit 62-GD/11-G to cab ground.

svcsubproc.title: Park/Side Marker Lights
svcsubproc.para: From body builder feed stud (J1), power is applied to circuit 14C, fuse E2, circuit 58, and headlight switch (60). When the headlight switch (60) is in the parking lights or headlights on position, power is fed to circuit 58A, connector (2), circuit 58D, connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 58D to a splice. From the splice, power is supplied to the left side marker light (503) over circuit 58E and to the right side marker light (505) over circuit 58F. On vehicles with the optional fender mounted dual face lights, power is also supplied to the left lamp (508) by circuit 58H, and the right lamp (509) by circuit 58J.

The ground path for the left side marker light (503) is circuit 11-GD/11-GB, connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ with 3600) to cranking motor ground. The ground path for the right side marker light (505) is circuit 11-GF/11-GE/11-GB, connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ) to cranking motor ground.

The ground path for the left dual face light (508) is circuit 11-GG/11-GB, connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ with 3600) to cranking motor ground. The ground path for the right dual face light (509) is circuit 11-GH/11-GB, connector (425) [connector (526) with 3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ with 3600) to cranking motor ground.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Light Switch - With Air Brakes
svcsubproc.para: From the body builder feed stud (J1), power is applied to circuit 14A, fuse D3, and circuit 70 to stop light switch connector (79). From the connector, power is supplied to the secondary air system stoplight switch on a red wire. From the connector (79), power is also supplied through circuit 70B, connector (80) and a red wire to the primary air system stoplight switch. When the brake pedal is applied, power flows in parallel through the closed contacts and brown wire of each switch and back to switch connector (79) and (80).

When the brake pedal is applied, the primary air system stoplight switch (80) supplies power to the body builder connector (194) through circuit 70C and 70E/70A. Power is also supplied to the ECM (379), pin 43, through circuit 70C and 70E/97N, bulkhead connector (3) and circuit 97N. At the same time power is also applied to circuit 97M, bulkhead connector (3) and circuit 97M to the ECM pin 44 as a redundant signal.

With the brakes applied, the secondary air stoplight switch (79) supplies power to the body builder connections through circuit 70E/70A and to the ECM pin 43 through circuit 70E/97N, bulkhead connector (3) and circuit 97N. As a redundant signal to the ECM, power is also applied to circuit 70C and 97M, bulkhead connector (3) and circuit 97M to ECM pin 44.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Light Switch - With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: From the body builder feed stud (J1), power is applied to circuit 14A, fuse D3, and circuit 70 to stop light switch connector (51). When the brake pedal is applied, the closed contacts of the stoplight switch supply power to the body builder connector (194) through circuit 70C/70A.

When the brakes are applied power is also supplied to the ECM (379), pin 43, through circuit 70C/97N, bulkhead connector (3) and circuit 97N. At the same time, power is supplied to the hydraulic brake monitor module (49) through circuit 70C/90R. The monitor module compares this signal to a signal it receives from the hydraulic brake switch.
